alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 4:46AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WARM-UP CONTINUES ACROSS THE MATANUSKA VALLEY, ANCHORAGE, AND THE WESTERN KENAI PENINSULA... Temperatures have warmed to near or above freezing for much of the region from the Kenai Peninsula northward to Anchorage and the Matanuska Valley. Localized gusty winds coming across the Kenai and Chugach Mountains will lead to additional warming today, with the entire region expected to rise above freezing. Another round of light rain is expected today, crossing the Kenai Peninsula mid to late morning, then the Anchorage and Matanuska Valley midday to early afternoon. Rainfall will be light and brief in any one location. In fact, some areas may remain dry or just see a few sprinkles. Still, any rain that does fall onto cold roadways will likely lead to icy conditions. A larger storm will cross the Gulf of Alaska today and head inland across Prince William Sound sometime late tonight or Wednesday morning. This has potential to bring heavier precipitation and cause more significant impacts to travel along area roadways. The exact track of this storm remains uncertain, making it difficult to nail down precipitation amounts and precipitation type. Most likely, precipitation would start as rain tonight and possibly transition to snow by Wednesday morning. Stay tuned to the latest forecasts by visiting weather.gov/afc.
